comments.content:
Because of slight variations on the characters, my guess is that a filter was applied to Millcreek in Illustrator to create the rough edges.   
   
Font is not ringing a bell, though.   
   
Harvest looks hand-drawn.
I thought Kennerley too but the M is wrong.

Look at [Numbers 1, 2 and 5 on this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224946/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=Millcreek&search%5Btext%5D=Italian+Old+Style) (Italian Old Style, Jenson and Veronese). The 'k' needs serif clipping and a new dot on the 'i' (along with the previously mentioned filtering) and you might make a close approximation.
